title: 111th Problem 2016
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"An improvised rocket is launched from the top of a building "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"150 \text{ feet}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" high. The height"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{ (H) }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"reached by the rocket after"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{ (t) }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"seconds is given by the function:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large H( t ) =40t-10{ t }^{ 2 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the distance of the rocket from the ground (in feet) after 3 seconds?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In this question, just substitute t = 3 in the given equation. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H(t) = (40 × 3) - (10 × 3^2) = (120 - 90) = 30"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
So, the distance from the ground is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"150 + 30 = \boxed{180}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" feet."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the question we can write that 10+4=2
so we can say 4=-8
and 11+2=9+4=9-8=1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: An algebra problem by Rindell Mabunga
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(3^2 - 2)(9^2 - 8)(513^2 - 512)(134217729^2 - 134217728) = 2^a - b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are integers and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is minimized, what is the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a + b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a + 1)^2 - a = a^2 + a + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a - 1)(a^2 + a + 1) = a^3 - 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(3^2 - 2)(9^2 - 8)(513^2 - 512)(134217729^2 - 134217728)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2^2 + 2 +1)(2^6 + 2^3 + 1)(2^{18} + 2^9 + 1)(2^{54} + 2^{27} + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2 - 1)(2^2 + 2 +1)(2^6 + 2^3 + 1)(2^{18} + 2^9 + 1)(2^{54} + 2^{27} + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(Note: Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 + 1 = 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 - 1 = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":")"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2 - 1)(2^2 + 2 +1)(2^6 + 2^3 + 1)(2^{18} + 2^{9} + 1)(2^{54} + 2^{27} + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2^3 - 1)(2^6 + 2^3 + 1)(2^{18} + 2^9 + 1)(2^{54} + 2^{27} + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2^9 - 1)(2^{18} + 2^9 + 1)(2^{54} + 2^{27} + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2^{27} - 1)(2^{54} + 2^{27} + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{81} - 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 81"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a + b = 81 + 1 = 82"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1 + 1 = 2 (Need to draw, Part 6)
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A man walks "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 \\text{ km}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" east then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 \\text{ km}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" northwest. How far is he from his starting point?"}]}]}

title: 112th Problem 2016
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Borro takes a job starting with an hourly wage of $14 and is promised a raise of $5 per hour per two months for 5 years."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"After 5 years, what would be Borro's hourly wage?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that 5 years = 30 half years.   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the wages follow an "},{"type":"text","text":"arithmetic progression","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19, 24, 29, \cdots"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
The wage at the end of 5 years is the 30th term of this arithmetic progression = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19 + (30-1)×5 = 19 + 145 = \color{#3D99F6}{\boxed{164}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: A classical mechanics problem by Aman Joshi
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A car moving along a straight road at a speed of u m/s applies brakes at t = 0 second. The
ratio of distances travelled by the car during 3rd and 8th secondis 15 : 13. The car covers a
distance of 0.25 m in the last second of its travel. Therefore, the acceleration a(in m/s2)
and the speed u(in m/s) of the car are respectively"}]}]}

title: 113th Problem 2016
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/IyALVwktBR-parallel-circuit.jpg?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given the parallel circuit above with the following values:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" { R }_{ 1 }=100\Omega \\ \\ { R }_{ 2 }=300\Omega \\ \\ { R }_{ 3 }=600\Omega \\ \\ { V }_{ T }=150V "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the total resistance ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" { R }_{ T } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") of the circuit."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Give your answer to 2 decimal places."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is part one of the problem."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{Resistance in a parallel connection is given by} \\ 
\frac{1}{R_p} = \frac{1}{R_1} + \frac{1}{R_2} + \frac{1}{R_3}\\
\implies \frac{1}{R_p} = \frac{1}{100} + \frac{1}{300} + \frac{1}{600} \\ 
 = \frac{1}{100} (\frac{1}{1} + \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{6}) = \frac{1}{100} ( frac{3}{2}) \\
\implies \frac{1}{R_p} = \frac{3}{200} \\ 
\implies R_p = \frac{200}{3} = 66.6666\\
\therefore \text{ The answer is } \fbox{66.67}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The reciprocal of the equivalent resistance of a set of resistors connected in parallel is equal to the sum of reciprocals of the individual resistances:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{R_T}=\dfrac{1}{R_1}+\dfrac{1}{R_2}+\dfrac{1}{R_3}+..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we have,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{R_T}=\dfrac{1}{100}+\dfrac{1}{300}+\dfrac{1}{600}=\dfrac{3}{200}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R_T=\dfrac{200}{33}=66.67"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Total resistance in a parallel circuit is the reciprocal of the sum of the reciprocals of the individual resistors. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
In this question, the individual resistance is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{\left(\dfrac{1}{100} + \dfrac{1}{300} + \dfrac{1}{600}\right)}^{-1}\\ \\
= \dfrac{600}{9}\\ \\
= \color{#3D99F6}{\boxed{66.67 \Omega}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
